author: Dave Urbanski
title: Black college president blasted as â€˜overseerâ€™ of â€˜Trump plantationâ€™ following meeting at White House
text:
The president of a prominent black college was blasted as the â€œoverseerâ€ of the â€œTrump plantationâ€ in a spray-painted message â€” along with other graffiti on the Howard University campus â€” after a White House meeting with leaders of historically black colleges. Graffiti at Howard University called its president an "overseer" at "Trump plantation." https://t.co/KZK3g4g8Zp pic.twitter.com/QW2tCfrBhe 
â€” DCist (@DCist) March 1, 2017 
Washington, D.C., stations WTTG-TV and WRC-TV said Howard University President Wayne A.I. Frederick was part of Mondayâ€™s meeting at the White House. Pres Trump welcomes officials from Historically Black Colleges & Universities into the Oval Office. Plans to issue Exec Order on HBCUs. pic.twitter.com/prx4jJNokX 
â€” Mark Knoller (@markknoller) February 27, 2017 
The graffiti was discovered Tuesday morning on the Washington, D.C., campus, DCist reported . In today's episode of Howard University Shenanigans pic.twitter.com/W6aEMrc98H 
â€” Lauryn Kai (@1april_fools) February 28, 2017 On today's episode of Only @ Howard â€¦ğŸŒšğŸŒšğŸŒš pic.twitter.com/pqkui0zHKh 
â€” Kiara Nelson (@KiaraLynne__) February 28, 2017 
Hereâ€™s Frederickâ€™s response to the graffiti: @Italia_calino In response to the vandalism on Howard's campus from President Frederick. pic.twitter.com/AzF8oypoNT 
Frederick also was criticized after meeting with Secretary of Education Nancy DeVos on campus in early February: We furthermore do not agree with the meeting that took place between Howard University and Betsy DeVos. 
â€” #HUAgainstHate (@HUAgainstHate17) February 10, 2017 
After her visit, Frederick said the school was â€œpleasedâ€ that DeVos â€œchose to visit our institution as her first official campus visitâ€ and that Howard has â€œa longstanding, successful relationship with the Department of Education, and I look forward to advancing this relationship under the Secretaryâ€™s leadership,â€ DCist reported. Thanks to @HUPrez17 & student leaders for the great discussion @HowardU today. Congrats on #HowardU150 ! pic.twitter.com/OfkP5w1nV9 
â€” Betsy DeVos (@BetsyDeVos) February 9, 2017 
Some students werenâ€™t buying it, though: @HUPrez17 @usedgov @BetsyDeVos you don't deserve to be the president of this institution. You need to go 
In fact, a student group â€” HUResist â€” met with Frederick and demanded Howard reject federal funding and ban Republican President Donald Trump from all university-affiliated buildings, the outlet noted. 
HUResist said it wasnâ€™t behind the spray-painted message against Frederick: Just for clarification: the spray paint and messages on Howard's campus were not an official action by HUResist.
